item.description:
Please arrive in time to be in your kayak (butts in boats) and ready to paddle at 5:30.  Plan to spend about 2-1/2 hours on the water which will bring us back to the boat launch around sunset.   It's blackfly season.  I haven't had a huge problem with them yet, but some headcovering (bug net if you have one) might not be the worst idea, just in case. They seem worse in my yard than over at Whitehall.  If you plan to spend a lot of time outdoors this time of year, those bug nets that go over your hat are inexpensive and can fit into a pocket.  If you always bring it you can almost be guaranteed you won't be see a bug ;-)  You can buy them locally at places like EMS:

http://www.ems.com/product/index.jsp?productId=3657115

IMPORTANT: Do not program "Whitehall State Park" into your GPS.  The parking for the boat launch is on Route 135 between Hopkinton and Westborough Centers.  The nearest Road to the launch is Dale Road in Hopkinton.

***PLEASE NOTE*** The organizers in this group are NOT trained leaders or instructors.  The organizers only set the time and place, each person participating in any group trip is responsible for their own safety.  Each participant is responsible for evaluating all relevant conditions for the trip and determining if their skills and equipment are appropriate for those conditions.

Required: PFD (worn), whistle, headlamp/flashlight.  Optional/recommended: pump/bailer, insect repellent, water, snack, change of clothes in drybag.
item.name: Paddle at Whitehall State Park
